title: Crazy new strategies
body: I was wondering if anyone had any cool ideas to try out. Anything is welcome, whether its stuff like AD Crittlesticks or the support with smite. I'm looking forward to all the fun, crazy stuff you can come up with!

replies.body:
I love off the wall stuff like this!

My favorite one that I came up with is doing Leona/Wukong bot lane.  The first few levels are rough but once you hit 3 you can bully the shit out of the standard marksman/support bot lane.

then try pantaleona botlane

so much stun and protection :p
That sounds like fun! And the level 2 powerspike lol

Hmm, not a bad idea. I usually run Leona jungle these days, as her ganks are SO SCARY! Get Challenging Smite with Cinderhulk and you can actually kill squishies surprisingly easily with the true damage.

The thing that gives Leona jungle an advantage over Sejuani or Nautilus is that Solar Flare has a much shorter cooldown than Glacial Prison or Depth Charge. This means Leona can ult-gank a lot more often than the other two main jungle tanks. Also, her Sunlight passive in ganks adds unexpected damage to the ganks that opponents won't usually take into account, resulting in them dying because they took more than they were expecting.

I also run Ohmwrecker on her when I jungle. For one, 40% CDR on Leona is a must (Ohmwrecker, Frozen Heart, Locket of the Iron Solari). Second, Ohmwrecker gives her good ability to disengage via Point Runner if she's near a turret (she lacks disengage, so this can be really important). Lastly, Ohmwrecker is godly for tower dives, which Leona excels at already.

I basically run smite on every tank champion i own, regardless of position. The Cinderhulk is such a good item, why not? Get that as a support after maxing out your face of the mountain, you'll be sitting at close to 3k HP already, which, unless you're fighting a Vayne, is really scary.

Also, it's been a helluva long time since i built a sightstone. With the trinkets there's just so much more we can do. Granted you can take the red trinket and a sightstone, or pink ward trinket and sightstone, but usually if the whole team wards, its actually not that necessary, and the extra stats you get out of getting better than a sightstone make you a beast.

Get some early XP by taking smite on Leona and taking Krugs. Rotate the Leona stun and the Krug stun to minimize damage, move between autos as well. Build Smite into Challenging Cinderhulk (synergy with Face of the Mountain and Eclipse).
A friend and I have run Leona/Jarvan bot lane for years now. Has 100-0 damage potential from level 2, eventually forcing the enemy to be completely zoned and allowing Leona to roam as she pleases.

That sounds awesome! Plus you have a wombo combo for teamfights
 Im gonna try this one out!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e9ZJE2atc1I
enjoy

was call tryhard by a katarina/fiddle/ap ez/ap panth/ziggs for buidling banner of command on my syndra with exhaust xD

poeple who doesn't use banner at all in URF against ap comp make me sad :(

Have you seen the anklespankin banner video? I love it
I also love anklespankin lol

try full atk speed braum, combo his passive with bork passive and you have a real manly man that can back his adc or take on the carry himself if the ad carry roams.

Also shaco top is fun and fresh.
I got rekt recently by an atk speed braum as riven. I have no idea how  tho lol. Also is the shaco top ap or ad?

the joy of shaco is he can be whatever the heck you want. I have an ap, ad, and tank build. The ap build for me is weakest but that probably since I'm building it wrong. I mostly do ad and the ap and tank are situatonal but you can do whatever. Some guys id recomennt to you are shaclone, pink ward, and whitecrow. They are all fine shaco mains. Shaclone is the most eplorative but pink ward is a epic ap shaco, while whitecrow mostly goes ad. I hope you take the time needed to really enjoy and get good with shaco.

I recently had an idea of full tank jungle Fiddlesticks, but I haven't tried it out yet.

Since Fiddlesticks already has enough CC in his kit to make him useful if he doesn't build damage and some sustain to keep him alive in fights, he could potentially make for a really strong tank that survives quite a long time in teamfights, especially considering how strong Cinderhulk is. This also doesn't factor in how strong Crowstorm is as an engage ability.

The problem with Fiddlesticks as a tank is that he is relatively squishy compared to other tanks that use Cinderhulk (especially with his lack of scaling MR), and a lot of his engage potential and sustain both need ability power to make really strong, but I think these problems are small enough that the strengths of the idea would work, but work so well that there aren't clear weaknesses.

I think a hybrid build would work best. Something like cinderhulk/roa/sv or randuins/zhonyas/sv or randuins/mercs/tabi/whatever. Leaves you with a solid ~230 ap and (making this up) 3300 hp? That way your drain scales better, plus benefits from sv passive.
You could try the Shyvana top TP/Smite
Hmm... I've never heard of this one before, care to elaborate? Im assuming its AD/Tank...

You build Shyv top with Cinderhulk and run Skirmisher's Sabre. The goal is to push the wave quick with her area damage, and when it's pushed, farm the jungle nearby in relative safely. The smite benefit is two fold--the true damage and damage reduction in a duel, but it also makes it quick, easy, and virtually painless to dive into your jungle or the enemy's quickly for some counterjungling.

It can require a bit of coordination, but it gives your team a weak enemy jungler, while at the same time securing top and providng a second possible gank with her TP up.
I think it's a top lane/counter jungle build.

For Urf I found a lot of enjoyment running Xin/Kalista lanes. Its a good choice if your team needs some AD damage output. 

Support Anivia is not something you see often but something I find a decent amount of success doing. Works best with a Vayne ADC.
List of stuff you can teleport onto that you may not already know: Jarvan's flag, Thresh's lantern, Rek'sai's tunnels, Malzahar's voidlings, Elise's spiders, Heimerdinger's turret, Teemo's mushroom & Zyra's plants to name a few.

Shen has amazing synergy through his ultimate with the following champions: Nocturne, Twisted Fate & Pantheon. They also have amazing synergy with one another. Twisted Fate's ultimate gives sight of all enemy champions. Nocturne can only ult onto champions he can see. Nocturne's ultimate decreases the sight range of all enemy champions which helps Pantheon "man leap" onto enemy's without alerting them with the big giant circle that usually pops up. And Shen just shields them all and makes map presence really strong on your team.

I wonder if a Shen/Pantheon/Twisted Fate/Nocturne and maybe a Jinx comp would work? Shen top, Nocturne Jungle, TF mid, Pantheon support, Jinx ADC... the backdoors would be hilarious! Thanks, this is exactly what I was looking for.

> [{quoted}](name=flamebird3,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=b02W8B55,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-04-08T02:08:06.896+0000)
>
> I wonder if a Shen/Pantheon/Twisted Fate/Nocturne and maybe a Jinx comp would work? Shen top, Nocturne Jungle, TF mid, Pantheon support, Jinx ADC... the backdoors would be hilarious! Thanks, this is exactly what I was looking for.

Not a problem. You can also substitute Jinx with either Ezreal, Ashe or Draven since they all have global ultimates. And Shen also functions in the support role as can twisted fate. And Shen and pantheon can jungle as well, so the team is pretty versatile in who goes where. And the setup fills most every role too: Shen is a tank, Pantheon is a bruiser, Twisted Fate is a mage and Nocturne is an assassin.

Another comp to run is a disengage/peel composition. This is pretty much a keep away setup where it screws over anyone with a gap closer and makes assassins cry. They can't stay around long enough to kill anyone so you can take objectives with relative safety. Xin Zhao, Janna, Tristana, Alistar and Azir are some of the better ones. Lee Sin, Syndra, Anivia, Gnar, Vayne, Thresh, Volibear and Singed also function in being able to do this effectively.

Or one thing that used to work is stealth bombing. It requires Zilean and any champions that can go invisible. Twitch and Shaco are generally the preferred targets since they can get up close without ever getting detected. Great way to screw with your enemy opponents.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UJXKUXax17U

Edit: Calbel, the guy who made the video, has some interesting stuff on his channel if you want to try some crazy stuff.

Thank you very much for this! I'll be sure to check out his channel and try this sometime.
As an aside, I wonder if the Stealth Bombers would work with orianna ball? I think it does, because of the whole Rengar/Orianna thing, but I'm not sure.

> [{quoted}](name=flamebird3,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=b02W8B55,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-08T20:01:04.810+0000)
>
> Thank you very much for this! I'll be sure to check out his channel and try this sometime.
> As an aside, I wonder if the Stealth Bombers would work with orianna ball? I think it does, because of the whole Rengar/Orianna thing, but I'm not sure.

In theory it will work, but Orianna has to be within range of her ball in order for it to stay where you placed it. When you exceed the range the ball appears back on you. So that's kind of why Orianna is so hard, she has to be very excelled at positioning herself and knowing the range of her ball. I've had it happen where I send the ball on someone, they run off ahead and just when I want to use my ult the ball appears back on me. So it will work if Orianna is close enough, but because she has to be a set distance from the ball to keep it in place she broadcasts her plan a little bit. With the stealth bombing there is no range. Idk if you saw one of the pieces of the video but there is a part where you see Twitch turn invisible without any bombs on him. Shen then ults him and when he appears there is a time bomb with 1 second on it and it instantly explodes killing the target. Shen could have been anywhere on the map to make that happen (another reason Shen is a great champion) Zilean can then kill his targets through those means. I thought that was the best play of the video. I never would have thought of that on my own.

with the heavy bruiser meta right now, there is a curve-ball choice for mid: AP Nasus
it's hard to figure out...and there needs to be more of an exploration into the match-ups...but AP Nasus could be exactly what you are looking for.
He has a long range aoe poke that bursts and then burns anyone in it (equal to the amount of the burst if they are in it the whole time)...AND it shreds armor. 

Now envision a team fight. Your adc and your top are probably ad...and chances are that your jung is too, (best case scenario would be if top and jung were also tanky). Throwing down an E not only damages more than one of your enemies, but anyone who steps in it (and it lasts 1-sec after they are out of it) will have reduced armor (-20 at lvl1, -40 at lvl5). 

Say goodnight to the other team. They took your burst and you took their armor...so your team can clean up the mess.

This sounds interesting... is it full ap nasus or ap/tank?  Ap tank with roa would make more sense. Also since you seem to know alot about nasus, i want to ask you something- what do you think of a hybrid/sustain build? Something like hydra/gunblade/bt/boots/spirit visage/warmogs? Obviously the items are subject to change, but i feel like a tanky, sustainy, high mixed damage late ge monster would be hilariously fun.  What do you think?

I like support Twisted Fate for several reasons. Aside from solid damage (if you need it) he has a good, reliable, targeted stun, or an area slow, and provides himself good mana sustain and a global presence with his ult. 

One I've seen but never used is Morg + Kat bottom. The pair have a good synergy and a steady power climb, relative safety from ganks with Black Shield and Shunpo, and a massive all-in at level 6.

My friends and I do a lot of this stuff in our ranked 5's. 

Typically we'll put a ranged character (sometimes adc, sometimes ranged mage) top. Our bot lanes are always off the wall. One that we really enjoy is pantheon/shen. 

You have two characters with hard cc, tankiness and some burst. Shen q-e onto adc, pantheon q-w-e follow up, ignite if you need to and you'll either get first blood or heal/flash/recall. Congrats you just won the laning phase. I also like this setup because post-6 you have so much global pressure with shen and panth ults.

Full team goes tank. 

Malphite top, Vi jungle, Sion supp, Kalistadc, Cho Gath Mid.

Then 5 ZZ rot portals.

One of those "weird" comps that seems effective on bot lane is Morgana + Lux. I faced it once 2 seasons ago in a game. Those guys were premades and they knew what they were doing. Their ability synergy is incredible. If you are a hard engage support you have no chance against that combo (was playing Leona as i recall) while your adc is completely zoned out unless he/she wants to get poked all time. Basically not even the jungler can help out, because of Morg's shield + both of their Qs and Lux slow on E.

Needless to say i had lost that game and got a tons of reports from my angry teammates xD

A funny build I like playing sometimes in teambuilder is CA$he...basicly play Ashe with enough GP10 runes (seals/quints) to get +5GP10...then rush the crit item that builds into static shiv 1st, which puts you at +8 GP10 and procs and additional +2 gold per CS making you gain +5 GPCS With hawkshot. Then farm farm farm...

You can also go deeper in utility tree for the other gold related masteries for more Lulz, but it hurts your DPS  even more than the sub optimal runes. Still it's funny how fast you can accumulate gold with this build if you play safe and farm with a good support.

Well I wouldn't call them *new* strategies. After five seasons, most everyone has been tried at one point or another, but there are still good non-meta comps that can be fun.

While ADCs are usually peeled, it can be fun to run a full-on Protect The Carry team comp. Yorick top, Zilean mid, Janna support - two "revives" and Janna's Shield/Ult means you can really let your Vayne/Draven/Jinx run wild while you keep them alive.

Bot lane has a lot of comp options, if you are working together. Pick any two champions with hard CC, and you can make it work. Pantheon + Leona = Stunned for days. Or Ashe + Lissandra = Power of the Freljord - constant slows, and level 6 is a guaranteed kill with those two ults on one enemy.
